testing

test_createaccountview module

class testing.test_createaccountview.CreateAccountViewTests(methodName='runTest')

Bases: TestCase

The Test Case for the CreateAccountView

Contains tests for user creation functionality, ensuring correct responses to the functions

setUp()

Sets up the Test Case

Is called before each test to initialise the URL for the user creation end point

Returns:

None

test_create_account_success()

Test the successful creation of a user account

Sends POST request with valid user data and verifies:

  • Response status code is OK (200)

  • Only one user is created in the database

  • The user email matches the input data

Raises:

AssertationError – If any of the assertions fail

Returns:

None

test_create_account_email_exists()

Tests account creation with existing email

Creates a test user in database

Sends POST request with same email and verifies:

  • Response status code is Bad Request (400)

  • Appropriate error message (“Email already exists on a user.”)

Raises:

AssertationError – If any of the assertions fail

Returns:

None

test_create_account_invalid_email()

Tests account creation with invalid email

Sends POST request with invalid existing email and verifies:

  • Response status code is Bad Request (400)

  • Appropriate error message (“Invalid email or username.”)

Raises:

AssertationError – If any of the assertions fail

Returns:

None

test_create_account_missing_fields()

Tests account creation with missing fields

Sends POST request with already missing password and verifies:

  • Response status code is Bad Request (400)

  • Appropriate error message (“‘password’ is missing.”)

Raises:

AssertationError – If any of the assertions fail

Returns:

None

test_create_account_weak_password()

Tests account creation with weak password

Sends POST request with intentionlly weak password and verifies:

  • Response status code is Bad Request (400)

  • Appropriate error message (“Password is too weak. Use a strong password with at least 6 upper and lower case alpha-numeric characters including special symbols”)

Raises:

AssertationError – If any of the assertions fail

Returns:

None

Bases: APITestCase

The Test Case for the ExerciseView

Contains tests for exercise creation functionality, ensuring correct responses to functions

setUp()

Hook method for setting up the test fixture before exercising it.

test_create_exercise_success()

Test the successful creation of an exercise

Sends POST request with valid exercise data and verifies:

  • Response status code is OK (200)

  • the response contains correct exercise data

  • The exercise data matches the input data

Raises:

AssertationError – If any of the assertions fail

Returns:

None

Raises:

test_generateotpview module

class testing.test_generateotpview.GenerateOTPViewTests(methodName='runTest')

Bases: APITestCase

The Test Case for the GenerateOTPView

Contains tests for generating and sending an OTP to user email, ensuing correct responses to functions

setUp()

Sets up the Test Case

Is called before each test to initialise the URL for the generate otp end point

Creates a test User to use to simulate sending otp email

Returns:

None

test_generate_otp_success(mock_smtp)

Tests the successful generation and sending of OTP

Sends POST request to simulate generation and email sending proccess and verifies:

  • Response status code is OK (200)

  • Response message indicating success (“OTP sent.”)

Parameters:

mock_smtp (unittest.mock.MagicMock) – Mocked SMTP_SSL object to simulate email sending

Raises:

AssertationError – If any of the assertions fail or response content is not valid JSON

Returns:

None

test_email_sending_failure(mock_smtp)

Tests the faliure of a generation and sending of OTP

Sends POST request to simulate faluire in email sending proccess by raising SMTPException and verifies:

  • Response status code is Bad Request (400)

  • Appropriate error message (“Email failed to send.”)

Parameters:

mock_smtp (unittest.mock.MagicMock) – Mocked SMTP_SSL object to simulate email sending

Raises:

AssertationError – If any of the assertions fail

Returns:

None

class testing.test_logexerciseview.LogExerciseViewTests(methodName='runTest')

Bases: APITestCase

Test Case for the LogExerciseView

setUp()

Sets up the Test Case

Is called before each test to initialise the URL for the log exercise end point

Creates a test User and test Exercise to use in test

Returns:

None

test_log_exercise_success(mock_get_exercise, mock_get_user)

Tests the successful logging of an exercise

Sends POST request with valid exercise data and verifies:

  • Response status code is OK (200)

  • LoggedExercise instance was created with matching data

  • Response message indicating success (“Exercised Logged!”)

Parameters:

  • mock_get_exercise (unittest.mock.MagicMock) – Mocked function to get exercise by name

  • mock_get_user (unittest.mock.MagicMock) – Mocked function to get user by email or username

Raises:

AssertationError – If any of the assertions fail

Returns:

None

test_user_not_found()

Tests the logging of an exercise when the user is not found

Sends POST request with non existent username and verifies:

  • Response status code is Bad Request (400)

  • Appropriate error message (“Could not find associated user.”)

Raises:

AssertationError – If any of the assertions fail

Returns:

None

test_no_exercise_info(mock_get_exercise, mock_get_user)

Tests the logging of an exercise with missing data

Sends POST request with missing exercise data and verifies:

  • Response status code is Bad Request (400)

  • Appropriate error message (“Exercise log must contain some exercise information.”)

Parameters:

  • mock_get_exercise (unittest.mock.MagicMock) – Mocked function to get exercise by name

  • mock_get_user (unittest.mock.MagicMock) – Mocked function to get user by email or username

Returns:

test_reset_password_success(mock_get_user)

Tests successful password reset using a verified user

Sends a POST request with new password and confirmation and verifies:

  • Response status code is OK (200)

  • Checks that the password has been updated in the database

Parameters:

mock_get_user (unittest.mock.MagicMock) – Mocked function to get user by email or username

Raises:

AssertationError – If any of the assertions fail

Returns:

None

test_otp_not_verified(mock_get_user)

Tests password reset with an unverified user

Sets verifed status to false

Sends a POST request with new password and confirmation and verifies

  • Response status code is Bad Request (400)

  • Appropriate error message (“OTP not verified. Validate or request another.”)

Parameters:

mock_get_user (unittest.mock.MagicMock) – Mocked function to get user by email or username

Raises:

AssertationError – If any of the assertions fail

Returns:

None
